title: Deno Registry Completion Schema
description: A definition of meta data that allows a Deno language server form auto completion suggestions for modules within a module registry.

version.description: The version of the schema document.

registries.description: The registries that exist for this origin.

schema.description: The Express-like path matching string, where a specifier in the editor will be matched against, and the variables interpolated to provide a completion suggestion.

variables.description: The variables that are contained in the schema string.

key.description: The variable key name in the schema, which will be used to build the completion suggestions.

details.description: An optional "endpoint" to call to provide details for specified variable, which can be displayed to the client in the response. This can provide description information about the item.

parts.description: An optional "endpoint" to call to provide incremental results of a complex variable, delimited by a path separator of "/".

url.description: The "endpoint" to call to provide values to complete the specifier. This endpoint should return an array of strings. Parsed values can be substituted using ${key} syntax.
